intro: Utricularia scandens subsp. firmula, commonly known as the firmular bladderwort, is a carnivorous plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and specialized bladder-like structures used for capturing prey. This subspecies typically grows in moist, nutrient-poor environments such as wetlands and marshes. The plant is epiphytic, often found attached to trees or other plants in its habitat. Its flowers are usually small and inconspicuous, with a distinctive bilabiate structure typical of the family.
